actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the Joint Meeting was dissolved. The House remains in recess subject to the Call of the Chair.
The House convened in Joint Meeting with the Senate to receive an address by His Excellency Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of the Republic of India.

The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. Pursuant to a previous order of the House, the House will reconvene for a Joint Meeting with the Senate for the purpose of receiving His Excellency Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of the Republic of India.

The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate did not pass H.J. Res. 44, and the House received a message that S.J. Res. 11, on reconsideration, failed, the objections of the President of the United States to the contrary is withstanding.
ACTING CLERK OF THE HOUSE

Pursuant to the provisions of section 208(a) of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946, the Chair appointed Mr. Kevin McCumber of the State of Illinois, to act as and to exercise temporarily the duties of the Clerk of the House of Representatives effective July 1, 2023.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Cheryl L. Johnson, Clerk of the House of Representatives. Mrs. Johnson notified the House of her resignation, effective 11:59 p.m. on June 30, 2023, as Clerk of the House of Representatives. The resignation was accepted without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 461 — "Condemning the use of elementary and secondary school facilities to provide shelter for aliens who are not admitted to the United States."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 219
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 529 — "Relating to the resolution (H. Res. 503) impeaching Joseph R. Biden, Jr., President of the United States, for high crimes and misdemeanors."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 529 and agreeing to the resolution, if ordered, and agreeing to H. Res. 461.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 22.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 461, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution, and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Scott (VA) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered on the resolution and the preamble pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 461.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3564, H.R. 3799 and H. Res. 461. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 3564 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate; H.R. 3799 under a structured rule with eighty minutes of general debate; and H. Res. 461, under a closed rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on H.R. 3564 and H.R. 3799.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 524. H. Res. 461 — "Condemning the use of elementary and secondary school facilities to provide shelter for aliens who are not admitted to the United States."

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 529, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question, and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 529.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 529 — "Relating to the resolution (H. Res. 503) impeaching Joseph R. Biden, Jr., President of the United States, for high crimes and misdemeanors."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Auchincloss to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Scott Fitzgerald to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
